formatted_items.content:
Subject: Information Needed for Book-Cover Design Email to Mary

Hi [Name],

I’m drafting the note that will go out to Mary (mary.designer@freelancegraphics.com) with the full brief for our upcoming book-cover designs. Could you please pull the items below from John’s Gmail and “The Editor’s Companion” workspace and send them to me?

1. Project overview
   • Working titles and subtitles  
   • Author names and pen names (if any)  
   • Genre and target readership  

2. Creative direction
   • Any mood boards, inspirational images, or color/typography preferences already discussed with the authors  
   • Specific do’s and don’ts noted in earlier email threads  

3. Content & assets
   • Final back-cover copy / marketing blurbs  
   • Author bios and headshots (if required on the cover)  
   • Logos, imprint marks, and any brand-style guidelines  

4. Timeline & logistics
   • Key milestones: first draft, revisions, final files  
   • Preferred file specs (trim size, spine width, required formats)  
   • Final deadline for printer hand-off  

5. Reference materials
   • Links to comparable covers the authors or John liked  
   • Any reviewer quotes or award seals that must appear  

If you could drop these into a shared Google Drive folder or simply forward the relevant emails/Notion pages, that would be perfect. Let me know if you have any questions—otherwise, a quick heads-up once everything’s gathered would be greatly appreciated so I can finalize Mary’s brief.

Thanks so much for your help!

Best,  
[Your Name]
